snippet: Soldiers gathered at the sliver of land separating Crimea and the rest of Ukraine leave little doubt that they have dug in for the long haul.
abstract: De facto border checkpoint near Amaryansk, Ukraine, on northern edge of the Crimean Peninsula, dispels any doubt about Russia and its supporters being serious about holding on to territory.

byline.contributor: Patrick Reevell contributed reporting from Armyansk, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Soldiers gathered at the sliver of land separating Crimea and the rest of Ukraine leave little doubt that they have dug in for the long haul.

headline.main: Mystery Men at De Facto Crimean Border Help Fuel Suspicion and Dread
headline.print_headline: Mystery Men at De Facto Border Help Fuel Suspicion and Dread
